entities: International Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia
summary:
The Security Council,

Adopted resolution 1877 (2009) at its 6155th meeting on 7 July 2009.

The Council recalled its previous resolutions, particularly 1503 (2003) and 1534 (2004), which called on the International Tribunal to complete investigations by the end of 2004, trial activities by the end of 2008, and all work in 2010.

Noting the International Tribunal's assessment that it will not complete its work by 2010, the Council decided to:

1. Review the extension of the term of office of permanent judges at the International Tribunal, who are members of the Appeals Chamber, by 31 December 2009.

2. Extend the term of office of the following permanent judges until 31 December 2010, or until completion of assigned cases:
- Carmel Agius (Malta)
- Jean-Claude Antonetti (France)
- Christoph Flügge (Germany)
- O-Gon Kwon (South Korea)
- Bakone Justice Moloto (South Africa)
- Alphons Orie (Netherlands)
- Kevin Parker (Australia)
- Patrick Robinson (Jamaica)

3. Extend the term of office of new permanent judges replacing Iain Bonomy, Mohamed Shahabuddeen, and Christine Van den Wyngaert until 31 December 2010.

4. Extend the term of office of currently serving ad litem judges until 31 December 2010.

The Council aims to support the International Tribunal's completion of its work and urges it to take measures to complete its work expeditiously.
The Security Council 
- elects  Melville Baird (Trinidad and Tobago), 
- Pedro David (Argentina), 
- Elizabeth Gwaunza (Zimbabwe), 
- Frederik Harhoff (Denmark), 
- Uldis Kinis (Latvia), 
- Flavia Lattanzi (Italy), 
- Antoine Kesia-Mbe Mindua (Democratic Republic of the Congo), 
- Michèle Picard (France), 
- Árpád Prandler (Hungary) 
- Stefan Trechsel (Switzerland)
